questions.question: Which of the following is not a natural estrogen?
A 55-year-old postmenopausal lady is on estrogen as part of her hormone replacementtherapy. Which of the following statements about estrogen is not true?
questions.explanation: Estrogen causes an increase in plasma HDL levels.Estrogen also causes an increase in triglycerides, apolipoprotein levels, and an increase in theturnover of LDL receptors.

questions.question: A post-menopausal lady who is on estrogen therapy for hot flashes is concerned about itsadverse effects. She is not at an increased risk of developing which of the following cancers?
questions.explanation: Women receiving estrogen therapy do not have an increased risk of developing gall bladdercarcinoma.Long-term estrogen therapy can increase the risk of gall stones. Although gall stones can beassociated with the development of gall bladder carcinoma, there is no direct correlation betweenlong term estrogen therapy and gall bladder carcinoma.Estrogen therapy has been associated with breast, endometrial and hepatocellular carcinoma.680

questions.question: In which of the following conditions is hormone replacement therapy not helpful?
questions.explanation: Hormone replacement therapy(HRT) is not helpful in coronary heart disease.Progesterone used in the HRT is associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease,thromboembolism, and related mortality. Estrogens promote coagulation and thromboembolicepisodes.Options A and B: Estrogen is helpful in flushing and local preparations are preferred for vaginalatrophy.Option D: Estrogen is beneficial for osteoporosis if it is started before the onset of significantosteoporosis.Note: The use of HRT for cardiovascular benefits is quite controversial. The current consensus isthat the HRT should be started only after assessing the benefit/risk profile individually and is notindicated for the prevention of cardiovascular events in all menopausal women as it waspreviously advocated.

questions.question: Progestin dose remains constant throughout the cycle in which of the following type ofcombined contraceptive pills?
questions.explanation: Monophasic pills contain constant amounts of progesterone and estrogen that is taken daily for 21days, followed by a 7-day pill-free period.Biphasic and triphasic pills have variable amounts of active ingredients (especially progesterone)that mimic the natural changes in the hormonal levels in the menstrual cycle. These pills reducethe total amount of steroids that needs to be administered.

questions.question: A young lady who is on oral contraceptive pills refrains from taking any drug even for minorailments due to the fear of contraceptive failure. Which of the following drugs can be takensafely?
questions.explanation: Among the given drugs, aspirin use is least likely to cause contraceptive failure.Option B: Broad-spectrum antibiotics like tetracycline suppress the intestinal flora and interferewith the enterohepatic circulation of estrogen. This leads to lowering of plasma estrogen levelsand can result in contraceptive failure.Options C and D: Enzyme inducers like phenytoin and rifampicin increase the metabolism of oralcontraceptives and can cause contraceptive failure.

questions.question: A 23-year-old lady has been on anti-epileptic therapy since childhood and now comes to theOPD seeking advice on a suitable method of contraception. Which contraceptive methodshould be avoided in her?
questions.explanation: Oral contraceptives must be avoided or used cautiously in epilepsy.The most important aspect to consider is the drug interactions between anti-epileptic drugs andcontraceptives. There is no conclusive evidence on whether estrogen is beneficial or harmful for681seizure control.Note: Convulsive disorder is not an absolute contraindication; it is safe to avoid but can be usedwith caution.

questions.question: 673Which of the following statements about oral contraceptive pills is true?

options.B: It is protective against ovarian cancer
options.C: OCP are used in treatment mastalgia
options.D: Rifamipicin decreases the metabolism of OCP

questions.explanation: Oral contraceptive pills (OCP) protect against ovarian cancer.This benefit is thought to be due to the prolonged suppression of gonadotropin stimulation of theovary on long-term use of OCPS.Other benefits of oral contraceptive pills:••Lesser incidence of endometrial carcinoma due to progestin component in OCPRegularisation of menstrual cycles results in relief of dysmenorrhea and menorrhagia• Reduced incidence of fibrocystic breast disease and ovarian cysts• Endometriosis and pelvic inflammatory disease are improvedOption A: The estrogen component of combined oral contraceptive pills is mainly responsible forvenous thromboembolism.Option C: OCP is not used in the treatment of mastalgia. Mastalgia, chloasma, and breakthroughbleeding are known side effects of oral contraceptive pills.Option D: OCPs are metabolized by CYP3A4 enzymes. Rifampicin is a strong inducer of CYP3A4.Hence, if administered together, rifampicin can cause enhanced metabolism of OCPs and maylead to contraceptive failure.

questions.question: A 23-year-old lady on oral combined contraceptive pills misses a single dose and reports toyou in the OPD the next morning. What will be the most appropriate advice to this patient?

options.A: Continue taking the next dose as scheduled
options.B: Double the next dose to make up for the missed dose
options.C: Interrupt the course and start taking the medications again on 5th day of bleeding
options.D: Start a fresh course of OCP again

questions.explanation: The most appropriate advice for this patient who has missed a single dose of the oralcontraceptive pill (OCP) is to double the next dose to make up for the missed dose.Missed dose considerations for oral combined contraceptive pills:• If a single dose is missed - a double dose can be taken on the next day to make up for the misseddose.•If two or more doses are missed on subsequent days - the last missed pill has to be taken alongwith the present pill and alternative methods of contraceptive must be used for the next 7 days.• If the pills were missed on the last week (days 15-21) - omit the hormone-free interval byfinishing the hormonal pills in the current pack and starting the new pack from the next day.

questions.question: In which of the following patients is combined oral contraceptive pills not absolutelycontraindicated?

options.A: A perimenopausal woman with coronary heart disease
options.B: A 23-year-old lady with a past history of hepatic adenoma
options.C: A multiparous lady with abnormal undiagnosed vaginal bleeding

questions.explanation: 682A migraine headache is a relative contraindication for the use of combined oral contraceptives.Migraine with focal neurological symptoms is an absolute contraindication to combined oralcontraceptive use.Absolute contraindications to combined oral contraceptive use:•Presence or history of thromboembolic disease, cerebrovascular disease, myocardial infarction,coronary artery disease•Congenital hyperlipidemia⚫ Known or suspected carcinoma of the breast, female reproductive tract• Known or suspected pregnancy• Past or present liver tumors or impaired liver function•Undiagnosed vaginal bleeding.•Migraine with focal neurological symptomsRelative contraindications to combined oral contraceptive use:•Migraine headaches in >35 yrs female• Hypertension• Diabetes mellitusObstructive jaundice of pregnancy• Prior oral contraceptive use• Gallbladder disease

questions.question: Progestin-only pills do not act by which of the following mechanisms?

options.D: Eliciting an inflammatory action in the endometrium

questions.explanation: Copper intrauterine devices elicit an inflammatory reaction within the endometrium. This impairssperm viability, motility, and fertilization.All the following actions contribute to the contraceptive action of progestin-only pills:• The effectiveness of this drug is largely due to the thickening of cervical mucus which in turnimpair sperm penetration.•Inhibits ovulation via exerting negative feedback on the hypothalamus (GnRH). This leads to theabsence of the FSH and LH surge, which is essential to mature the dominant follicle and triggerovulation.•Interfere with the implantation of a zygote by altering the endometrial environment.The major reason women discontinue the use of progestin-only contraceptives is breakthroughbleeding.

questions.question: 674A 35-year-old lady, P2L2, has been taking depot medroxy progesterone acetate as acontraceptive. Which of the following best describes the formulation?
questions.explanation: 683Depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA) is a long-acting progestin-only injection formulation.DMPA is administered every 3 months intramuscularly as a contraceptive.

questions.question: Which of the following progesterone is used in emergency contraception?
questions.explanation: Levonorgestrel is the progesterone that is used in emergency contraception.Levonorgestrel-containing regimens are considered the standard regimen now.Option B: Micronised progesterone is indicated for amenorrhea and to counteract estrogen effectson the uterus.Option C: Norgesterone is usually used along with ethinyl estradiol for regular contraception.Option D: Depot medroxyprogesterone acetate is a long-acting depot preparation indicated forlong-term contraception.

questions.question: A newly married couple came to the OPD saying that they had unprotected intercourse twodays back but are not desiring a baby at present. Which of the following drugs can beprescribed in this case?
questions.explanation: Ulipristal is a selective progesterone receptor modulator (SPRM) that can be given as anemergency contraceptive in this case.It should be administered within 5 days of unprotected intercourse.It inhibits ovulation by suppressing LH surge as well as by direct effect on follicular rupture. Inaddition, its action on the endometrium can interfere with implantation.

questions.question: The standard emergency contraceptive pill regimen, levonorgestrel can be taken up to howmany hours after unprotected intercourse?
questions.explanation: Levonorgestrel regimen can be taken within 72 hours after unprotected intercourse but is mosteffective when taken as early as possible.Levonorgestrel for emergency contraception can be taken as either of the following:• 2 tablets of 0.75 mg 12 hours apart• 1.5 mg single-dose

questions.question: A 20-year old lady came to the OPD with complaints of missed period. You diagnose her to be5 weeks pregnant but she is not willing to continue the pregnancy. You decide to prescribeher a drug that has anti-progestational activity. Which of the following drugs wouldchoose?
questions.explanation: Mifepristone (RU-486) has potent anti-progestational (abortive activity) and significantanti-glucocorticoid and antiandrogenic activity.Options A and B: Levonorgestrel and desogestrel are progesterone preparations.Option C: Misoprostol is a synthetic prostaglandin (PGE1) preparation.684

questions.question: In the treatment of which of the following patients will you not consider clomiphene citrate?

options.B: A 48-year old perimenopausal woman with hot flashes.

questions.explanation: Clomiphene citrate is not used in the treatment of hot flashes.Option A- Clomiphene increases gonadotropin secretion and stimulates ovulation. It mainly actsby blocking the inhibitory actions of estrogen on gonadotropin release from the pituitary gland. Itis primarily indicated in the management of infertility.Option C - In men also, clomiphene increases gonadotropin secretion and promotesspermatogenesis. However, success rates are low.-Option D Studies have shown clomiphene citrate to be effective in treating and preventingshort-lasting unilateral neuralgiform headache attacks (SUNCT). It has not yet beenFDA-approved for the treatment of SUNCT.

questions.question: A 45-year-old lady, diagnosed with breast cancer, is started on a selective estrogen receptormodulator. Identify the drug.
questions.explanation: Raloxifene is a selective estrogen receptor modulator.It has agonist action on bone and antagonist action on the breast and uterus.It is used in the treatment and prevention of osteoporosis and in breast cancer prevention inhigh-risk postmenopausal women.

questions.question: A 60-year-old lady who is on tamoxifen, for the treatment of breast cancer is worried aboutits side effects. Which of the following side effects of tamoxifen is least likely to occur in thispatient?
questions.explanation: Tamoxifen acts as an estrogen receptor antagonist in breast tissues. The use of tamoxifen incarcinoma of breast patients decreases the incidence of carcinoma in opposite breasts.The estrogen agonistic action of tamoxifen and its consequences are:• Uterine endometrium - endometrial hypertrophy, vaginal bleeding, and endometrial cancer•Coagulation system - thromboembolism leading to pulmonary embolism (tamoxifen decreasesthe level of antithrombin III and protein C in the blood)•⚫ Bone metabolism - increase in bone mineral density• Liver alterations of blood lipid profile• Cataract

questions.question: Which of the following is a selective estrogen receptor down regulator?
questions.explanation: Fulvestrant is a selective estrogen receptor down-regulator. It does not have estrogen agonisticactivity for any tissue and is regarded as a pure estrogen antagonist.685Tamoxifen, toremifene, and raloxifene are selective estrogen receptor modulators with the agonistor antagonist action at different tissues.

questions.question: Which of the following is an aromatase inhibitor?
questions.explanation: Exemestane is an aromatase inhibitor.Estrogen is locally produced from androgen by the action of the aromatase enzyme. Locallysynthesized estrogens play an important role in the development of breast cancer because they areestrogen-dependent for proliferation.Aromatase inhibitors decrease estrogen synthesis and are widely used now in the treatment ofbreast cancer in postmenopausal women.Aromatase inhibitors are:⚫ Letrozole•• Anastrozole• Exemestane (Irreversible inhibitor)

questions.question: You decide to change the chemotherapeutic regimen of a patient with breast cancer fromtamoxifen to an aromatase inhibitor. Which of the following is not an advantage of the latterin the treatment of breast cancer?

options.A: No increase in risk of venous thromboembolism
options.B: No increase in risk of endometrial cancerCan be used in advanced cases which are tamoxifen-resistantd) They maintain bone mineral densityQuestion 23:Yuzpe's regimen of emergency contraception consists of which of the following?a) Etonogestrel + ethinylestradiol677b) Levonorgestrel + ethinylestradiol

questions.explanation: Aromatase inhibitors lack the property of maintaining bone mineral density when compared totamoxifen.Aromatase inhibitors dramatically reduce estrogen levels that result in a decrease in the risk ofvenous thromboembolism and also decreases the risk of endometrial hyperplasia/cancer. It is alsoindicated in tamoxifen-resistant advanced breast cancer.

questions.question: You are an intern posted in the medicine ward and you notice the given dermatologicalfinding in a patient with abdominal distension. Which of the following hormones isimplicated in this finding?
questions.explanation: The image shown is of spider nevus and the hormone implicated in its development is estrogen.It is commonly seen in hyperestrogenic states such as pregnancy and in those takingestrogen-containing contraceptives. It can also be seen in male patients with cirrhosis due to thedecreased ability of the liver to metabolize circulating estrogens, specifically estrone, whichderives from the androgen androstenedione. Estrogens cause blood vessels to enlarge and dilate.

questions.question: A 28-year-old man presents to the OPD with the following condition. Which of the followingdrugs can cause this adverse effect?678
questions.explanation: This is a case of gynecomastia which can occur as an adverse effect of spironolactone orketoconazole or chlorpromazine.Spironolactone - decreases testosterone production, increases peripheral conversion oftestosterone to estradiol, and displaces estradiol from their plasma-protein-binding sitesKetoconazole decreases testosterone production and displaces testosterone from their bindingsitesChlorpromazine (neuroleptics) - increase prolactin release by blocking the inhibitory action ofdopamine on prolactinClomiphene and tamoxifen are used mainly in reducing male gynecomastia.687
